name: CVE-2009-4215
description: Panda Global Protection 2010, Internet Security 2010, and Antivirus Pro 2010 use weak permissions (Everyone: Full Control) for the product files, which allows local users to gain privileges by replacing executables with Trojan horse programs.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_vista:*:*:64-bit:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_xp:*:*:32-bit:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_vista:*:*:32_bit:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:pandasecurity:panda_global_protection:2010:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:pandasecurity:panda_internet_security:2010:*:pro:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:pandasecurity:panda_antivirus:2010:*:pro:*:*:*:*:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
